page.title: 17Birds around Crathie
page.content: Woodland birds include wood pigeons, treecreepers, jays, siskins, goldcrests, green woodpeckers, great spotted woodpeckers, woodcock, tawny owls, long eared owls, sparrowhawks, capercaillie, coal & long tailed tits, Joined in summer by cuckoos,redstarts, spotted flycatchers &willowwarbler. On moorland red grouse & meadow pipits also wheatear in summer. Merlin, hen harriers, peregrine occasionally. On farmland, rooks, jackdaws, pheasant, yellow hammers, starlings all year, joined in spring by black headed gulls, common gulls, oystercatchers, curlews, peewit & golden plover. Buzzards, kestrels & short eared owls hunt overhead. Swallows in summer.Grey heron at watersides,with grey wagtails & common sandpipers in summer.Pied wagtails very common in the area. On the water mallard. Dippers in the Dee.
